title: theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets

items.title: ‘I’m a big fan of DIY investing’: I’m 64 and moving to the U.S. I have $2.6 million, but no Social Security. Will I be OK?
items.description: “Advisers do well in bull markets and poorly in bear markets, while I generally do better during downturns than the S&P 500.”

items.title: What’s the true price of Thanksgiving? Trump says groceries are getting cheaper, but many Americans are still concerned about costs.

items.title: I’m in my 50s and divorced with a $1.7 million home. I fell in love with an old school friend. Does it make financial sense to marry?
items.description: “I have a $500,000 Roth IRA, a portfolio account of $500,000 and $300,000 in 529 plans.”
